answers.text: You must be logged on as a root account to create IAM Users in a specific region.
You don't have the right permissions to be able to select a region.
IAM is global so it doesn't require or use regions.
The region is set after you have created an IAM User.

text: You've been tasked by your company to create a new IAM User in the US-EAST-2 region. You are finding that all regions are greyed out and you cannot select what you want. What could be the reason for this?
